welcome.title: Welcome to Stuga
welcome.subtitle: A beautiful dashboard for Home Assistant

url.title: Connect to Home Assistant
url.label: Home Assistant URL
url.hint: Enter the URL you use to access Home Assistant
url.hintWeb: Nabu Casa, DuckDNS, or other public HTTPS URL
url.webNote: Local addresses like homeassistant.local won't work from the web. You need a public URL with HTTPS.
url.webNoteApps: For local network access, use the iOS or Android app instead.
url.webSetupNote: Add this to your Home Assistant configuration.yaml:
url.error: Could not connect. Check the URL and try again.
url.foundMultiple: Found Home Assistant at multiple addresses:

token.title: Authentication
token.label: Long-lived Access Token
token.hint: and create a Long-Lived Access Token
token.instructions: In Home Assistant: Profile (bottom left) → Security → scroll to Long-Lived Access Tokens → Create Token
token.error: Invalid token. Please check and try again.

authMethod.title: Choose login method
authMethod.subtitle: How would you like to authenticate?
authMethod.oauthHint: Use your existing Home Assistant account
authMethod.tokenHint: Enter a long-lived access token manually

storage.title: Data Storage
storage.subtitle: Choose where Stuga stores your customizations like room order
storage.haLabelsHint: Room order and preferences sync across all your devices. Stuga will add labels prefixed with stuga- to your areas.
storage.localStorageHint: Keeps your Home Assistant clean — no stuga- labels will be added to your areas

syncToHA.title: Sync room order to Home Assistant
syncToHA.description: Room order is stored locally by default. Enable to sync across devices (adds stuga- labels to HA).

editMode.title: Edit Mode
editMode.instructionsTooltip: All changes you make here are immediately saved to Home Assistant.
editMode.infoHoldToEdit: Hold a room, floor or device to edit it
editMode.infoHoldToMove: Hold again to reorder while in edit mode
editMode.infoSelectMultiple: Tap multiple items to select them for bulk editing
editMode.infoSavesDirectly: All changes are saved directly to Home Assistant

connectionError.title: Connection Problem
connectionError.troubleshootNetwork: Check your network connection and verify the Home Assistant URL is correct.
connectionError.troubleshootSsl: The SSL certificate could not be verified. This may happen with self-signed certificates or expired certificates.
connectionError.troubleshootSslHostname: The SSL certificate doesn't match the server address. If you use DNS rebinding (local DNS override), check if your phone has Private DNS enabled in Settings → Network → Private DNS and try disabling it.
connectionError.troubleshootDns: The hostname could not be resolved. Check that the address is correct and that you have internet connectivity.
connectionError.troubleshootWebsocket: WebSocket connections may be blocked by your network or proxy. Try connecting from a different network.
connectionError.troubleshootAuth: Your access token may have expired or is invalid. Try reconnecting with a new token.
connectionError.troubleshootServerDown: Home Assistant may be restarting or offline. Check that it's running and try again.
connectionError.troubleshootUnknown: An unexpected error occurred. Check your connection settings and try again.
connectionError.autoReported: Error details are sent automatically. For follow-up, report on GitHub with your debug ID.

rooms.reorderHint: Drag to reorder, tap to edit
rooms.noDevices: No controllable devices in this room
rooms.emptyFloor: This floor is empty. Long-press a room to move it here, or browse All Devices.

hints.structureEmpty: Organize your home by long-pressing any device to assign it to a room.
hints.noFloors: Group your rooms by floor. Long-press a room to assign it.

domains.title: Device types

roomOrdering.title: Room ordering
roomOrdering.description: Hold and drag to reorder rooms

debugId.title: Debug ID
debugId.description: Share this ID when reporting issues

alsoHideInHA.title: Also hide in Home Assistant
alsoHideInHA.description: Hidden devices are also hidden in HA
alsoHideInHA.enableMessage: When enabled, hiding a device in Stuga will also hide it in Home Assistant. Devices you've already hidden in Stuga will be hidden in Home Assistant too.
alsoHideInHA.disableMessage: This will unhide all Stuga-hidden devices from Home Assistant. They will remain hidden in Stuga.

disable.title: Disable Room Ordering
disable.message: This will remove the hold-to-reorder feature and delete all room order data from Home Assistant. You can re-enable this later, but you'll need to set up your room order again.

room.title: Delete Room
